blocks.reason: Architecture phase requires complete tech stack definition. Cannot design system architecture without knowing frontend framework, backend language, database type, authentication provider, and hosting platform.
blocks.resolution:
Complete all 5 tech stack components:
  • Frontend Framework
  • Backend Language/Framework
  • Database Type
  • Authentication Provider
  • Hosting/Deployment Platform

blocks.reason: System cannot be built with contradictory requirements. Must resolve conflicts before proceeding.

examples.reason: Real-time features require WebSocket backend, incompatible with static hosting
examples.resolution: Use serverless functions + WebSocket service (Pusher, Ably) OR choose dynamic hosting

examples.reason: SSR requires server for each request, conflicts with offline-first architecture
examples.resolution: Choose one: PWA for offline OR SSR for SEO

examples.reason: Serverless has execution time limits (10-15min), unsuitable for long-running processes
examples.resolution: Use background job queue (BullMQ, Celery) OR dedicated compute instances

examples.reason: NoSQL not optimized for joins and complex relationships

blocks.impact: Blocks progression - system cannot be built with contradictory requirements
blocks.resolution: Review conflicting features and choose one approach. Document why alternative was rejected.

blocks.reason: PRD too vague to proceed to architecture phase. High risk of rework and scope creep.
blocks.resolution: See /forge-status for specific deliverables needing completion

blocks.reason: Cannot build without clear feature definitions. Acceptance criteria missing or incomplete.

examples.specific: User dashboard showing: workout history (last 30 days), progress charts (weight/reps over time), upcoming scheduled workouts, personal records
Stripe integration for: monthly subscriptions ($9.99/mo), annual plans ($99/year with 2 months free), payment method management, invoice history
Analytics dashboard showing: daily active users, feature usage heatmap, conversion funnel (signup → first action → retention), user session recordings

blocks.resolution:
Add acceptance criteria to each feature. Define what 'done' looks like:
  • What data/content is shown
  • How users interact with it
  • What actions they can take
  • What the result looks like

healthcare.reason: Healthcare apps handling PHI must comply with HIPAA regulations
questions: Will you store Protected Health Information (PHI)?
What data encryption standards are required?

fintech.reason: Financial apps handling payments must comply with PCI-DSS and financial regulations
questions: Will you process credit card payments?
What financial regulations apply (PCI-DSS, SOX, etc.)?

ecommerce.reason: E-commerce apps processing payments must comply with PCI-DSS
questions: Will you process payments directly or use a provider (Stripe, PayPal)?
What regions will you operate in? (affects GDPR, CCPA)

blocks.impact: Legal/regulatory risk - cannot launch without compliance
blocks.resolution: Add industry-specific compliance deliverables to PRD

warnings.reason: Unclear what's in v1 vs v2+. High risk of scope creep and delayed launch.
warnings.impact: Warning only - does not block progression if overall confidence >= 95%
warnings.resolution:
Clearly define:
  • What's in MVP (v1.0)
  • What's deferred to v2+
  • Why each item is in/out

warnings.reason: No clear definition of 'success'. Risk of building features that don't drive outcomes.
warnings.impact: Warning only - does not block progression if overall confidence >= 95%
warnings.resolution:
Define 3-5 KPIs:
  • What to measure
  • Target values
  • How to measure
  • When to measure
